mechanics.trigger: Creature starts its turn in the line of wind
mechanics.condition: Creature fails a Strength saving throw
mechanics.outcome: Creature is pushed 15 feet away from the caster in a direction following the line

mechanics.trigger: Creature starts its turn in the line of wind
mechanics.condition: Creature succeeds on a Strength saving throw

mechanics.trigger: Creature attempts to move within the line of wind
mechanics.condition: Creature is moving closer to the caster
mechanics.outcome: Creature must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot moved

mechanics.condition: Gas or vapor is present in the line's area
Unprotected flame (e.g., candle, torch) is present in the line's area
Protected flame (e.g., lantern) is present in the line's area
mechanics.outcome: Flame dances wildly and has a 50% chance to be extinguished

mechanics.trigger: Caster's turn while Gust of Wind is active
mechanics.outcome: Caster can change the direction of the line of wind

description_text: A line of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the spell's duration. Each creature that starts its turn in the line must succeed on a strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the line. Any creature in the line must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you. The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them. As a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends, you can change the direction in which the line blasts from you.
